title: SickDayIn
author: SickDayIn
content: By pure chance I recently discovered this independent documentary called "Bitcoinners", which came out on 14th November 2024. To quote the abstract:Bitcoinners is an independent documentary film that takes an inside-look at the grassroots movement of die-hard bitcoin devotees and why they think Bitcoin can save America. Filmed from 2021 to 2023, this film follows a group of bitcoin plebs in Texas, and includes key interviews with well-known bitcoin voices.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FcaQ-EifEJYI wanted to share this documentary with everyone here, as the it focuses on the individual stories of people within the Bitcoin community and avoids covering any technical details of the blockchain. Instead it really highlights how Bitcoin influences our lives and ideologies. I feel that this documentary would be engaging and interesting even to audiences that are unfamiliar or don't understand Bitcoin. Are you aware of any similiar documentaries or films that focus on personal stories and ideologies around Bitcoin?

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: SickDayIn on November 29, 2024, 01:20:00 PMwhy they think Bitcoin can save America. Filmed from 2021 to 2023, this film follows a group of bitcoin plebs in Texas, and includes key interviews with well-known bitcoin voices.Bitcoin can not save any country, and this fact won't change.A country is big and complicated with many elements that decide its success or failure, and Bitcoin as a single element, can not change a failed nation to a succesful one. It's unrealistic mission for Bitcoin and Bitcoin does not have that mission when it was created by Satoshi Nakamoto.It's clickbait trick by politicians or Youtubers or people who want to make noise on social media.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: I don't get too excited about movies and won't get excited about movies on Bitcoin, many directors, film producer are always looking to make money so most of this stories including any that would involve Bitcoin has to be sweetened so as to captivate viewers, yes it may be good in terms of having new people converting to Bitcoin when the story throws a positive light on Bitcoin but my fear is that I would rather see people joining Bitcoin after they must have understood the advantages and disadvantages also understand that it's not completely safe out here too and scammers are also here looking for Prey.Only giving out a positive vibe like Bitcoin can save America or the world is misleading. Let's not spread some false narratives just to get people hooked, some people has joined Crypto-currency and left because of what they were told wasn't what they experienced.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Quote from: dzungmobile on November 29, 2024, 01:38:17 PMBitcoin can not save any country, and this fact won't change.Well this is definitely a disputable point of view and I'll definitely explain why. Now the first question is why do individuals and big firms have an advantage when they Hodl bitcoin? To answer this let's talk about the effect of inflation which is dawning on literally every country since it's a world problem but the downside effects of inflation is more intense in some countries than others simply because of economic management and utilisation of resources. Now if you agree that bitcoin can combat inflation then you can also agree that bitcoin can prevent a country from falling into economic crisis. Now for the OP, I've also come across a channel that teaches kids economics and even bitcoin in one episode.

I have not watched any bitcoin movie before because I am not really into movies though. Documentaries and films like this are not really bad though,  it will help to create an awareness about the availability of a certain currency which the viewers may not have seen before. However, while praising the abilities of bitcoin, we should also be mindful not to over-glorify it to the point of sending out misleading information to the public.Bitcoin alone cannot singlehandedly save a country from whatever problems it may be facing. It might try to address some economic issues, but the government on their part have a major roles to play in ensuring economic, social and political stability in their country.
